reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Coherently towards sustainable development with a stronger civil society network

description.narrative: Kehys is an advocacy network for Finnish civil society organisations pushing for more sustainable European Union. Kehys is the Finnish national platform of CONCORD.The stated impact of Kehys?s programme is that EU policies and development cooperation becom e more coherent and contribute more towards sustainable development globally. The aim of Kehys action is to influence EU and global decision making and governance structures so that they support and allow progress towards sustainable development. Special e fforts will be made to ensure that the main policies of the EU are aligned with the 2030 Agenda and support its coherent implementation across the administration. At global level advocacy will be focused on improving mechanisms and systems for monitoring a nd policy coherence. The 2030 Agenda and policy coherence are the main themes of the Kehys programme.The programme aims to influence and have impact especially on the EU?s 2030 Agenda implementation strategy or plan EU?s Multi-Annual Financial Framework Fi nland?s EU presidency programme and the implementation of the revised European Consensus on Development. Promotion of participation civil society space and policy coherence for sustainable development will be key asks in all processes. In addition a range of thematic messages from member organisations will be promoted and advocated for.The programme will have three outcomes: 1) Finnish CSOs promote globally sustainable and coherent European Union 2) Finnish CSOs produce quality funding applications to imple ment EU development cooperation 3) decision makers and officials make use of messages and positions of Finnish CSOs.Kehys will achieve these objectives by strengthening advocacy networking and knowledge capacities of CSOs as well as their capacity to apply for EU funding and by strengthening networking and knowledge capacities of decision makers and officials.
